column4: How much partitions and what size,filesystem i need to install ubuntu?
How much partitions and what size,filesystem i need to install ubuntu?
a reasonable minimum is probably 5 GB or so; i think the default install is 1.8 GB
the default fs is ext3
yeah, you'll need a swap partition too
i guess ~ 1 GB is about right for swap
it's a swap partition. as dabaslon said, let the installer handle that
try here: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/BinaryDriverHowto
according to synaptic, it's a 'NeXTSTEP-like window manager for X'
try 'apt-cache search pascal' ?
what do you want to know? And what are you trying to do?
i wanna learn how to use netcat i type nc 127.0.0.1:port but it gives me an erros
i wanna learn how to use netcat i type nc 127.0.0.1:port but it gives me an error
try 'nc 127.0.0.1 port'  where port is a number
reading the man page would be a good idea
you can probably tell grub to boot your mandrake partition
so your system is now booting mandrake?
there's no need to repeat yourself
try making the one master, the other slave (if they're on the same ide cable -- err, i don't know sata)
i mean, swap the master/slave arrangement
ok, then do what anto9us suggested
edit /boot/grub/menu.lst  (probably what you want)
have you installed 'build-essential' ?
thx for help i havent thought of that :D
